posts.post_content:
This is [Living Death](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living Death) without all that pesky "sacrifice" bullS\*\*t.   
  
I can't tell you how fun it is to get out 2 [Nightmare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightmare)'s, 2 [Massacre Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Massacre Wurm)'s, a [Demon of Death's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon of Death's Gate), and [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) with 2 [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive)'s and this.   
  
I mean, that is a little difficult to pull off, but it isn't far from plausible.
posts.html:
This is Living Death without all that pesky "sacrifice" bullS**t.

I can't tell you how fun it is to get out 2 Nightmare's, 2 Massacre Wurm's, a Demon of Death's Gate, and Sheoldred, Whispering One with 2 Buried Alive's and this.

I mean, that is a little difficult to pull off, but it isn't far from plausible.

posts.post_content:
Ok I have a question. I use Balthor the Defiled to bring back all the R&B cards from my graveyard including [Worldgorger Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldgorger Dragon). As Worldgorger comes into play I remove all permanents, would that include all my other resurrected creatures or not? I think so but I'm not 100% sure. Any ideas anyone?  
  
This guy is fantastic with [Morality Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Morality Shift) and [Songs of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Songs of the Damned) especially when you have creatures with beneficial "comes into play" effects.
posts.html:
Ok I have a question. I use Balthor the Defiled to bring back all the R&B cards from my graveyard including Worldgorger Dragon. As Worldgorger comes into play I remove all permanents, would that include all my other resurrected creatures or not? I think so but I'm not 100% sure. Any ideas anyone?

This guy is fantastic with Morality Shift and Songs of the Damned especially when you have creatures with beneficial "comes into play" effects.

posts.post_content: @baduncadunc: edh generals can be exiled. the thing is, after he is placed into exile, you have the choice of bringing him back the the command zone, or leaving him there. but, since he was already technically removed from the game as the cost, you can let him hit the command zone and the ability will still resolve.
posts.html:
@baduncadunc: edh generals can be exiled. the thing is, after he is placed into exile, you have the choice of bringing him back the the command zone, or leaving him there. but, since he was already technically removed from the game as the cost, you can let him hit the command zone and the ability will still resolve.

posts.post_content: Actually [Arc-Slogger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc-Slogger) doesn't play very nice with Balthor at all. Arc-Slogger exiles cards, while Balthor can only bring them back from the graveyard. What you want to use with Balthor is [Morality Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Morality Shift).
posts.html:
Actually Arc-Slogger doesn't play very nice with Balthor at all. Arc-Slogger exiles cards, while Balthor can only bring them back from the graveyard. What you want to use with Balthor is Morality Shift.
